page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The rectangle allocated to Kilndown C.E. Primary School contains parts of the Villages of Kilndown, Goudhurst and Lamberhurst. It lies in the Civil Parishes of Goudhurst, Lamberhurst and Horsmonden, and is administered by the Tunbridge Wells Borough Council. We are in the constituency of Tunbridge Wells and our M.P., Sir Patrick Mayhew, lives in Kilndown. The area is covered by woodland, managed by the Scotney Estate, and farms, growing mainly hops, cereals and grass, although some soft fruit and potatoes also occur. The churches of Kilndown and Lamberhurst are in this rectangle, along with Scotney Castle and the S.E. Regional Offices of the National Trust. Finchcocks House contains a museum of keyboard instruments, open to the public.
